org.pebble.core.encoding.ints

Class IntOutputOffset

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pebble.core.encoding.commons.OutputOffset
      • org.pebble.core.encoding.ints.IntOutputOffset

  • public class IntOutputOffset
extends OutputOffset
    Implements methods for the estimation of size in bits of the compression algorithms. This class is useful to decide which strategy are convenient to follow to compress a list without actually compressing it, saving computation time.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.pebble.core.encoding.commons.OutputOffset

    • Method Detail

      • getWriteDifferenceOffset

        public int getWriteDifferenceOffset(it.unimi.dsi.fastutil.ints.IntList list,
                           it.unimi.dsi.fastutil.ints.IntList referenceList)
        Estimates the number of bits required for the succinct difference representation between the given strictly incremental list and referenceList. For details of the representation (see writeDifference).
        Parameters:
        list - from which it will encode the difference with the closest reference.
        referenceList - reference list from which the difference will be computed. List must be strictly incremental with positives (including zero) values.
        Returns:
        number of representation bits.

      • getWriteIntervalsOffset

        public int getWriteIntervalsOffset(it.unimi.dsi.fastutil.ints.IntList list,
                          int valueBitSize)
        Estimates the number of bits required for the succinct intervals representation from strictly incremental list. For details of the representation (see writeIntervals).
        Parameters:
        list - from which it will extracts the intervals to encode. List must be strictly incremental with positives (including zero) values.
        valueBitSize - fixed number of bits used to represent value in list to be encoded. It can be any value between 1bit and 31 bits.
        Returns:
        number of representation bits.

      • getWriteDeltaOffset

        public int getWriteDeltaOffset(it.unimi.dsi.fastutil.ints.IntList list,
                      int valueBitSize)
        Estimates the number of bits required for the succinct delta representation from strictly incremental list. For details of the representation (see writeDelta).
        Parameters:
        list - to encode. List must be strictly incremental with positives (including zero) values.
        valueBitSize - fixed number of bits used to represent value in list to be encoded. It can be any value between 1bit and 31 bits.
        Returns:
        number of representation bits.

      • getWriteDeltaOffset

        public static int getWriteDeltaOffset(int x)
        Estimates the number of bits required for the delta encoding of x.
        Parameters:
        x - positive number (including zero).
        Returns:
        number of bits required to represent x in delta encoding.
